data.scheme_name: Energy Conservation Scheme - Capital Equipment - Existing
data.benefits: Scheme provides 75% reimbursement (up to Rs. 2 Lakhs) for conducting energy audit and subsidy on cost of capital equipment implemented to conserve energy, subject to a maximum of Rs. 20 lakhs.
data.eligibility: All existing industrial units located anywhere in the State are eligible under this scheme.
data.conditions:
1. The unit must file Udyam Registration Certificate (URC) and Haryana Udhyam Memorandum (HUM) on the portal. 
  2. The item of manufacture should not fall under the restrictive list by the State Government. 
  3. Assistance on capital equipment is provided only if there is at least a 15% reduction in average monthly electricity consumption compared to the previous 12 months. 
  4. If electricity consumption increases due to higher production, the claim will be examined by a committee. 
  5. Only investments in new plant, machinery, and equipment for energy efficiency are eligible for subsidy. 
  6. The unit should have obtained No objection certificate from the competent authority, if applicable. 
  7. The unit must be in commercial and regular production at the time of disbursement. 
  8. Subsidy will not be released to a closed unit.
data.beneficiaries: All existing industrial units anywhere in the state are eligible under this scheme.
data.prerequisites:
1. The unit must file Udyam Registration Certificate (URC) and Haryana Udhyam Memorandum (HUM) on the portal. 
  2. The item of manufacture should not fall under the restrictive list by the State Government. 
  3. Assistance on capital equipment is provided only if there is at least a 15% reduction in average monthly electricity consumption compared to the previous 12 months. 
  4. If electricity consumption increases due to higher production, the claim will be examined by a committee. 
  5. Only investments in new plant, machinery, and equipment for energy efficiency are eligible for subsidy. 
  6. The unit should have obtained No objection certificate from the competent authority, if applicable. 
  7. The unit must be in commercial and regular production at the time of disbursement. 
  8. Subsidy will not be released to a closed unit.
data.nodal_agency: Directorate of Micro, Small & Medium Enterprises, Haryana
data.context: To undertake the process and establishing technically and economically feasible means to achieve the same & suggest best ways to optimize the energy consumption leading to energy saving and cutting down electricity bills.
data.objective: To identify areas where excess energy consumption or wastage of energy is taking place.
data.description:
Scheme provides : 

Energy Audit Reimbursement : 75% or maximum Rs. 2 lakhs 

Subsidy on Capital Equipment : 50% reimbursement in 'D' category blocks, 40% in 'C' category blocks, 30% in 'B' category blocks, and 20% in 'A' category blocks. 

Subsidy Cap : Maximum Rs. 20 lakhs (once every 5 years) 

Note : No subsidy for energy audit if the recommendations are not implemented.
data.how_to_apply: Application on prescribed form for the reimbursement of expenses incurred in conducting energy audit  along with listed documents should be submitted to the Director/ Director General, Micro, Small and Medium Enterprises, through the web portal of the department.
data.funding_facilitator: Directorate of Micro, Small & Medium Enterprises, Haryana
data.funding_mechanism: The applicant will get the benefits after the approval from the concerned auhtority.
data.additional_info:
Link of list of Restrictive Industries in Haryana: https://www.hsiidc.org.in/uploads/estate_managements/170097742718HEEP%20restrictive%20list.pdf 

Categorization of Blocks : https://investharyana.in/content/pdfs/Re-categorization%20of%20blocks%2015.11.2018.pdf
data.checklist_info_a:
1. Copy of Udyam Registration Certificate (URC) and Haryana Udhyam Memorandum (HUM).
2. Certificate of Incorporation/ Partnership deed/Partnership registration/ Co-operative society
registration.
3. Board resolution/ Power of attorney
4. Change of Land Use (CLU)/ NOC from competent authority, if applicable.
5. Copy of Energy audit certification.
6. CA certificate of Expenditure (in original) giving the details (as per prescribed format)
7. Copy of the bills raised by certifying agency and proof of payment thereof.
8. Copy of GST return/Audited Balance Sheet for last financial year.
data.checklist_info_d:
Address: Haryana Civil Secretariat, 8th Floor, Chandigarh

Contact No.: 0172-5059102
data.beneficiary: All Industry - All Entities - Haryana - All MSMEs
